workflows.name: Website Content Publishing and Maintenance Workflow
workflows.description: A comprehensive real‑time workflow for creating, staging, and publishing website content using the CURRENT repository, the Codex agent, GitHub and Dropbox backup, and deploying to Systeme.io. It specifies tasks for authors to write/update local content, run AI agents in dry‑run and live modes, commit and push changes, back‑up via Dropbox, publish to the live site with canonical head snippets and asset uploads, perform pre‑publish QA, and archive milestones.

steps.step: Write or update local content in the repository (e.g., new pages, copy blocks, brand styles)
Run the Codex agent in dry‑run mode using a CLI command such as `python agent.py --dry-run "<prompt>"` to preview generated changes and verify correctness
dependencies: Write or update local content in the repository (e.g., new pages, copy blocks, brand styles)

steps.step: Execute the agent for real, generating HTML/CSS files and other outputs; examine the changes in VS Code
dependencies: Run the Codex agent in dry‑run mode using a CLI command such as `python agent.py --dry-run "<prompt>"` to preview generated changes and verify correctness

steps.step: Stage and commit changes with `git add -A && git commit -m "<message>"` and push to GitHub; wait for CI to run
dependencies: Execute the agent for real, generating HTML/CSS files and other outputs; examine the changes in VS Code

steps.step: Synchronize local changes to Dropbox for backup and ensure Dropbox and GitHub versions are in sync
dependencies: Stage and commit changes with `git add -A && git commit -m "<message>"` and push to GitHub; wait for CI to run

steps.step: Publish on Systeme.io: upload canonical CSS/manifest assets, paste the generated HTML into Systeme’s page builder, ensure head snippets and placeholders are correct, and test responsiveness
dependencies: Synchronize local changes to Dropbox for backup and ensure Dropbox and GitHub versions are in sync

steps.step: Perform a pre‑publish checklist: verify canonical styles load correctly, check all links and images, run incognito tests, and replicate the funnel across the site
dependencies: Publish on Systeme.io: upload canonical CSS/manifest assets, paste the generated HTML into Systeme’s page builder, ensure head snippets and placeholders are correct, and test responsiveness

steps.step: Archive or tag a milestone after publication and update documentation (e.g., updating README and summary documents)
dependencies: Perform a pre‑publish checklist: verify canonical styles load correctly, check all links and images, run incognito tests, and replicate the funnel across the site

workflows.notes: Based on the Workflow_Management_Tasks-Action_Overview document and final update checklists, this workflow is fully implemented and serves as the production path for content publishing and maintenance. Attachments include error logs showing test failures, Python environment listings, terminal environment contributions, and workspace repository layout which help diagnose environment issues.

workflows.name: Repository Consolidation and Flatten Strategy
workflows.description: An idea‑based plan to resolve duplicate repository structures (a nested CURRENT folder and archived InsightfulAffiliate_NextGenCopyAI) and to sanitize the Python environment. It proposes flattening the nested directory structure, removing duplicated test files, creating a new virtual environment, generating a requirements file, updating pytest configurations, and verifying with tests before committing the changes.

steps.step: Move or rename all source files from the nested CURRENT directory into the repository root, removing duplicate folder layers
Delete stale __pycache__ directories and ensure test files have unique basenames to prevent pytest ImportPathMismatch errors
dependencies: Move or rename all source files from the nested CURRENT directory into the repository root, removing duplicate folder layers

steps.step: Create a clean Python virtual environment (e.g., via `python -m venv .venv`) and reinstall project dependencies
dependencies: Delete stale __pycache__ directories and ensure test files have unique basenames to prevent pytest ImportPathMismatch errors

steps.step: Generate a requirements.txt from the new environment and update pytest.ini or equivalent to collect tests from the correct location
dependencies: Create a clean Python virtual environment (e.g., via `python -m venv .venv`) and reinstall project dependencies

steps.step: Run tests (`pytest`) to verify that the flattened structure and new environment work correctly
dependencies: Generate a requirements.txt from the new environment and update pytest.ini or equivalent to collect tests from the correct location

steps.step: Commit and push the flattened structure and new environment settings to the repository; update documentation explaining the consolidation
dependencies: Run tests (`pytest`) to verify that the flattened structure and new environment work correctly

workflows.notes: This plan originates from idea‑based documents (e.g., the GPT5‑IDE_setup‑chat conversation) and addresses issues such as the ImportPathMismatchError shown in the pytest error screenshot. It has not yet been executed, so follow‑up tasks are required.

workflows.name: Final Git Update and Pre‑Publish Checklist

steps.step: Use the codex agent or maintenance task to generate the canonical CSS and manifest files, then stage them in the repository
Run `git add -A`, commit with a descriptive message, and push to GitHub to update the current branch
dependencies: Use the codex agent or maintenance task to generate the canonical CSS and manifest files, then stage them in the repository

steps.step: Upload the generated assets (CSS, manifest, images) to Systeme.io or the chosen web platform
dependencies: Run `git add -A`, commit with a descriptive message, and push to GitHub to update the current branch

steps.step: Copy and paste the generated HTML file into Systeme.io’s page editor, verifying that placeholders and head snippets are correctly inserted
dependencies: Upload the generated assets (CSS, manifest, images) to Systeme.io or the chosen web platform

steps.step: Perform pre‑publish checks: open the site in incognito mode, ensure all assets load via the CDN, verify links and forms, and confirm SEO metadata
dependencies: Copy and paste the generated HTML file into Systeme.io’s page editor, verifying that placeholders and head snippets are correctly inserted

steps.step: After approval, publish the site and tag the release in GitHub and Dropbox for future reference
dependencies: Perform pre‑publish checks: open the site in incognito mode, ensure all assets load via the CDN, verify links and forms, and confirm SEO metadata
